Gustavo,

it's a good practice to observe if a theme was already discussed before you post a new topic. A question about one's favourite fonts is the kind of matter you will find in older topics – sometimes in a specific way, as "your favourite gothic sans" or "the best serif fonts for books".

So, firstly you may try to do a search using Google this way:  
"what are your favourite fonts" site: typophile.com

The forum has its own search, but it's not working by now.

Another good practice is what I'm doing now: although we both speak Portuguese, I wrote in English to let other users read our discussion.

This is a little off topic. But I just had a random question. I too am a huge fan of Neo Sans since the Vancouver Olympics started using the family in it's identity. FWIW the price has not gone up.

I assume you just looked at the Complete Family Pack. Note that Neo is a _huge_ family and that this package comprises a whopping 40 styles, all in OpenType. You can license single weight in OT format for $54. If you don’t need OT, legacy formats are available from $39.

Gustavo,

Please don’t expect an immediate reply to ‘ [an interesting and polemic question](http://web.archive.org/web/20140923053921/http:/www.typophile.com/node/67516)’, sent on a Sunday night. Frankly, I’m not interested at all in getting involved in private discussions via e-mail about illegal font sharing. If you like to learn about/discuss font licensing and other typography-related topics, you are very welcome to do so on this forum.

Here’s a link to [Neo® Complete Family Pack (Sans & Tech) at Monotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20140923053921/http:/www.fonts.com/FindFonts/detail.htm?pid=415112?lang=EN). Here’s [Neo Sans Regular](http://web.archive.org/web/20140923053921/http:/www.fonts.com/FindFonts/Detail.htm?pid=415088&/). I’m sure you can find the Italic and Bold without my help.  
Best regards and good luck with your exams,  
Florian

Neo Sans is not a free font, as you may have guessed from looking at sites that are selling it.

Why do you need this font? If you really need it, you should be able to get your client or sponsor to pay for it and get it legally. If you only need a font that has the same feel, I'm sure you will be able to find free fonts, or fonts that you already paid for and are bundled with other software, that are similar enough for your needs.

But if you are studying for university entrance examinations, I can't imagine why you would really need this font. Don't you mean you just really want the font? There is a difference between needing and wanting.

<cite>If I buy and download only Neo Sans Regular, is it possible that I italicise and bold this font?</cite>

Some software will produce mechanical obliques (false italics) and bolds from the regular, but this creates visual distortions and is not considered professional.

Gustavo - you're new here and haven't yet developed an established relationship with the community here. When you posted a message that asks for a commercially-sold font \*for free\* - well that's not only bad manners, it's unethical and also, in many cases, illegal. To top off this mistake, you made such a request here on a forum that's frequented and used by people who make a living designing and producing such creations - including Seb. Thus you are receiving "pushback".

So the lessons to learn are: Don't offend the community you're visiting, don't ask people to do something illegal, and finally, save up the money if you want it.
